entries.entry: Practiced creating functions with Book 2, ch. 4 exercises. Was able to get most of them but struggled with using the forEach array method within functions
entries.mood: I think the tide's with us. --Keep kicking.

entries.entry: Learned about adding HTML components to the DOM dynamically with Javascript. Struggled with the functions but ultimately finished almost all the exercises.
entries.mood: There's a clinical name for it, isn't there? --Drowning.

entries.concept: APIs, Rendering to the DOM, LinkedIn
entries.entry: Struggling with the steps to take to get the functions to work that render HTML to the DOM. Also need to remember not to procrastinate with LinkedIn. Keep up with it and it will save a lot of time. I have very little idea what's going on with APIs, but today was just an intro
entries.mood: I'll catch this bird for ya, but it ain't gonna be easy.

entries.entry: So today, I helped some friends with their journals, which was a great way to reinforce my learning of the JavaScript functions and how they interact with the API. BUT THEN, I realized I had accidentally deleted quite a few uncommitted changes to my own journal code....which meant it was not working, which meant I had to spend the rest of the rewriting it, which meant re-tracking-down stupid mistakes, such as typing "applicaTINO" instead of application. So THAT was cool.

entries.entry: Tried all day to filter my array of entries, but just couldn't get it to work. I started from scratch twice, and got some code from Haroon to modify. Still not working.

entries.entry: FINALLY got it to work. Once I got over myself and made it simple (by making the radio input values the same as the mood values) it, was pretty simple, especially since I had Haroon's code to follow.
entries.mood: You're gonna need a bigger boat.

entries.entry: After some struggle trying to get my delete buttons to work, I finally realized I had simply copied the wrong server URL. Wasted a lot of time. Otherwise, nailed it
entries.mood: I'll catch this bird for ya, but it ain't gonna be easy.
